quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Capital and City
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, geography, ocean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the capital city of Latvia?
This city is the capital of the Kingdom of Morocco.
Ethiopias capital is Addis Ababa.
What is the capital and largest city of Romania?
What is the capital and largest city of Lebanon?
What is the capital and largest city of the Republic of the Congo?
Kathmandu is the capital city of what country?
Name Moroccos capital that is also the capital of the Rabat-Salé-Zemmour-Zaer region.
What is the name of the capital city of India?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Delhi

questions.question: Bamako is the capital of Madagascar.
The capital city of what country is called Quito?
What port on the Atlantic Ocean is the capital and largest city of Guinea.
Name Zimbabwes capital which is an independent city equivalent to a province.
Addis Ababa is the capital of what country?
Tegucigalpa is the capital and largest city of this country.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Russia and Capital
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, phrase, falling-blocks. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The U.S. state of Oregon has been nicknamed after this animal, which is the official state animal.
What is the currency of Russia?
Albuquerque is the largest city of which U.S. state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Mexico

questions.question: Name the capital city of the U.S. state of Wyoming.
What is the capital and largest commercial city of Libya?
Who commissioned  the St. Basils Cathedral?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ivan the Terrible

questions.question: This city is Kenyas capital and the most populous city in East Africa.
Who is the first President of the Russian Federation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boris Yeltsin

questions.question: Tetris, the popular falling-blocks video game, was invented in Russia.
The first person in space was Russian.
Which U.S. state has been nicknamed The Silver State?
What phrase means I love you in Russian?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ya lyublyu tebya

questions.question: Alaska used to be part of Russia.
How do you say hello in Russian?
Victoria is the capital of the Republic of Seychelles.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Countries
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, beskydy, definition. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Cross Channel Euroregion includes France, the UK and what other country?
Where would you find the Tornio River Valley Euroregion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sweden / Finland

questions.question: Where would you find the Ore Mountains Euroregion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Czech Republic and Germany

questions.question: The state of Louisiana is bordered by the Gulf of Mexico on the south and three states. Which state does NOT border Louisiana?
What does the name of the U.S. state of Texas literally mean in Caddo?
The first recorded Euroregion, Gronau, was founded in 1958. What countries established it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Germany and Netherlands

questions.question: The Pyrenees-Mediterranean region is located along the border of which two countries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France - Spain

questions.question: The TriRhena Euroregion is spans these three countries crossed by the Rhine River.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France, Germany and Switzerland

questions.question: The Beskidy (Beskydy) Euroregion is located in the west part of the Carpathian mountain range. Which three countries does it span?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Czech Republic, Poland, Slovakia

questions.question: What is the closest definition of Santeria?

options.text: Another name for the Catholic Church in Lousiana.
Another name for the Protestant Baptists religion in Lousiana.
A Cuban based religion popular in Lousiana.
A Jewish based religion popular in Lousiana.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Cuban based religion popular in Lousiana.

questions.question: Name the capital city of the U.S. state of Montana.
When René-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle (Yikes!) claimed the territory he named it La Louisiane, which means....

options.text: Land of Lords or Land of the Lords.
Land of France or Long Live France.
Land of Life or The Life.
Land of Louis or The Lousiana.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Land of Louis or The Lousiana.

questions.question: The region of Pomerania (ger.: Pomern, pol.: Pomorze) is located in north Germany and Poland. Which river divides the region into two parts?
Which country is not a member of the Adriatic Euroregion?
The ore and coal rich region of Silesia (pol.: Ślask, ger.: Schliesien, cz.: Slezsko) was ruled by Germans, Poles, Czechs and Austrians. To which country does it mostly belong today?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Colorado and Following
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, peak, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Today people visit Colorado to go skiing, hiking, mountain biking and to enjoy the scenery. But 100 years ago, tourists more often went to the mountains to do what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soak in hot springs

questions.question: The huge grain industry in Colorado gives rise to breweries. Which of the following owns the biggest single site brewery located in Golden, Colorado?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Molson Coors Brewing Company

questions.question: What is the state animal of Colorado and the symbol of Rocky Mountain National Park?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Big Horned Sheep

questions.question: Was Isabella Bird the first woman to climb Longs Peak, the highest point in Rocky Mountain National Park?
What is the state fish of Colorado?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Greenback Cutthroat Trout

questions.question: What does the word Colorado mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colored Red

questions.question: Early Colorado ranchers raised cattle, sheep, hogs, chickens, and turkeys, with the main focus on cattle.
The Colorado River, the major river of the American southwest, flows through which national landmark?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the state motto of Colorado?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nothing Without the Deity

questions.question: What U.S. interstate runs east and west through Colorado?
Mesa Verde National Park in southern Colorado is best known for which of the following?

options.text: The best-preserved cliff dwellings in the U.S.
A very rare flower that only grows in the mountains

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The best-preserved cliff dwellings in the U.S.

questions.question: One the worlds largest silver nuggets was found in Colorado.
Located at the Peterson Air Force base in Colorado, NORAD is a military organization that tracks aircraft, missiles and space vehicles. It also tracks what fictional character?

On May 5, 1920 two Italian-Americans, Nicola Sacco and Bartolomeo Vanzetti, were arrested, tried, and executed for the April 15, 1920 murders of a South Braintree paymaster and security guard and theft of the payroll.

options.text: He was in Plymouth peddling fish at the time.
He was visiting friends in West Bridgewater.
He was at the Italian consulate in Boston.
He was at work and had a time-card to prove it.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was at the Italian consulate in Boston.

questions.question: What city in Colorado is known as the Richest Square Mile on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Central City, Colorado

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Volcano and Colorado
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, glenwood, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the highest volcano in Asia, and the highest point in the Middle East?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Damavand

questions.question: What is the name of the active volcano situated in Skamania County, Washington, USA, 50 miles (80 km) northeast of Portland, Oregon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount St. Helens

questions.question: What is the name of the most active volcano in Mexico, located mostly in the Mexican state of Jalisco?
On which of the islands of Papua New Guinea is the active volcano Ulawun located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Britain

questions.question: What legendary American frontiersman commanded a major fort in Colorado?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kit Carson

questions.question: What year did Colorado become a state?
In what US state is the Fourpeaked Volcano, also known as Fourpeaked Mountain, situated?
Glenwood Springs, Colorado was known for its hot springs and hospital. What famous outlaw and gun slinger expired from Tuberculosis there?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Doc Holliday

questions.question: The Arabic name of Mount Etna, the second-largest active volcano in Europe, was Jebel Utlamat. What does this mean in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mountain of Fire

questions.question: What city boasts the most parks in the US?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denver, Colorado

questions.question: What was the popular slogan of the Colorado Gold Rush?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pikes Peak or Bust

questions.question: On which continent is the famous active volcano Mount Nyiragongo located?
What does the Indonesian name of the Mount Merapi volcano, Gunung Merapi, mean in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mountain of Fire

questions.question: In what country is the active volcano Koryaksky located?
In what country is the active volcano Sakurajima located?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Sweden and Brazil
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, brazil, land. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the official language spoken by the citizens of Sweden?
What is the capital city of the Federative Republic of Brazil?
The Swedish name of Sweden is Sverige. What does this word literally mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kingdom of the Swedes

questions.question: What is the meaning of the Portuguese word brasa from which the name of Brazil possibly originated?
Which of these European countries shares a land border with Sweden?
What is the name of the largest city and capital of Sweden?
Which of these statements is wrong about the wildlife of Brazil?

options.text: It contains the most mammal species on the planet.
Brazil is the country with the largest biodiversity on the planet.
Brazil is the country with the most endemic species in the world.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brazil is the country with the most endemic species in the world.

questions.question: What is the prevailing religion in Sweden?
What are the colors of the national flag of Sweden?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue and yellow

questions.question: What type of government does Sweden have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Constitutional monarchy

questions.question: Which of these celebrities is not Swedish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lars Ulrich

questions.question: What are the colors of the national flag of the Federative Republic of Brazil?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White, blue, green and yellow

questions.question: What type of food is the popular Swedish dish called Surstromming?
What song is used as a de facto anthem of Sweden?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thou Ancient, Thou Free

questions.question: The self-governed region of the Holy Mountain is considered part of the Greek state according to a decree
